title: American_Top_40_1971_June_12th
description:
THIS FILE WAS PREVIOUSLY TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_June_12th,_1971" IF YOU DOWNLOADED THAT FILE YOU ALREADY HAVE THIS ONE. THIS IS THE NEW TORRENT OF THAT SAME FILE AND THAT TORRENT WILL NO LONGER BE SEEDED. THIS IS ONE OF THE FIRST 15 I EVER TORRENTED. I'M JUST CHANGING THE NAME SO ALL SHOW TITLES ARE FORMATTED ALIKE.
THIS FILE IS NOW BEING TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_1971_June_12th" PLEASE DOWNLOAD THAT TORRENT. THIS FILE IS NO LONGER BE SEEDED.

"The biggest hits are yet to come as we count 'em down on our way to a brand new number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

Isaac Hayes and the Jackson 5 both have the same song in the countdown.

Casey remembers the #1 song from 5 years earlier by the recording act that sold an average of one million records every week for seven years.

The biggest male solo act in pop music ever to come out of England has a song in this countdown.

Two listeners ask the same question, "What re
cord stayed in the number one position for the most consecutive weeks?" This hit recorded by The Weavers in 1950 held the top spot for 13 weeks.
